title: Aerobelt Australia-Food-Grade Air-Supported Conveyors
text:
Aerobelt Australia is a leading supplier of air-supported belt conveyors for the transportation of food products. 
The company has supplied more than 300 Aerobelt conveyors to several locations worldwide, predominantly in Australia. Air-supported conveyors for food produce 
Aerobelt air-supported conveyors are available in a variety of sizes and capacities to transport food produce, such as barley, rice and sugar. 
Belt widths range from 300mm to 1.8m, while conveyor lengths range from a few metres to several hundred metres and are available in a single or multi-stage configuration. 
Conveyor tonnage rates vary from a few tonnes per hour to more than 2,000t per hour. Fan-produced air-cushion belt conveyors 
Aerobelt's conveyors are air-cushioned belt conveyors. The belt is carried on a film of air, which is blown by a small fan into the air box (plenum) under the conveyor belt. Each fan is sufficient for approximately 200m of belt conveyor. 
The amount of air-holes in the trough, the air pressure and the volume are customised to the produce being conveyed. 
The standard construction material used is galvanised-steel; however, other installations have used stainless-steel for some or all components to meet hygienic, corrosive and abrasive environment requirements. Low belt friction and smooth movement air-supported belt conveyors 
The non-conventional construction of Aerobelt conveyors offers low belt friction and smooth movement of produce, thanks the range's air-supported belt design. 
Standard belt conveyors disturb produce during conveyance to the extent that there is product loss, contamination and abrasion. 
Aerobelt conveyors minimise product degradation when conveying large volumes, due to their fast and smooth conveyance. 
Other advantages of Aerobelt air-supported conveyors include: Produce can be conveyed at steeper inclines thanks to the low product disturbance Fewer moving parts offer quieter operation and less maintenance Improved safety with a physical barrier separating personnel and loaded belts Low power consumption offers smaller drives, reduced power requirements and lighter construction Reversible, single and dual-drive belt conveyors 
The Australia-based company's conveyors are reversible, enhancing the efficiency of both directions of conveyor feed. 
As required by individual applications, Aerobelt conveyors can reverse with a single or dual-drive. Food-grade belt conveyors 
Unlike their conventional conveyor equivalents, less expensive, lighter belts can be used due to the reduced working tension. Aerobelt conveyors can facilitate a variety of belt types, including food-grade belts, fire-resistant, anti-static (FRAS) belts and high-temperature belts (200Â°C). 
Aerobelt also has a range of conveyors to accommodate concave and convex profile curves to follow the curves of existing conveyor support gantries; if required, concave and convex curves can be accommodated in the same conveyor. Air-supported belt conveyor supply, installation and commissioning 
Aerobelt can supply its air-supported conveyors on a supply only, supply and commission, or supply, install and commission basis. 
The company is flexible to meet customer specific requirements and provides redesign and reconfiguration of existing support steelwork and footings services to meet individual customers' project needs. 
Aerobelt's portfolio of conveyors for the food industry includes a variety of standard conveyors with a number of options available as standard. About Aerobelt Australia
